added_lines: class RecreateServer(command.ShowOne): _description = _("Recreate server on a different host") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(RecreateServer, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'server', metavar='<server>', help=_('Server (name or ID)'), ) parser.add_argument( '--wait', action='store_true', help=_('Wait for recreate to complete'), ) key_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() key_group.add_argument( '--host', metavar='<host>', default=None, help=_("Set the prefered host to recreate the server on, " "note the host will be validated by the scheduler."), ) parser.add_argument( '--password', metavar='<password>', default=None, help=_("Set the password on the recreated instance"), ) parser.add_argument( '--shared-storage', default=True, type=bool, metavar='<shared_storage>', dest='shared_storage', help=_("indicates if the instance is on shared storage"), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): def _show_progress(progress): if progress: self.app.stdout.write('\rProgress: %s' % progress) self.app.stdout.flush() compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server) server = server.evacuate(host=parsed_args.host, on_shared_storage=parsed_args.shared_storage, password=parsed_args.password) if parsed_args.wait: if utils.wait_for_status( compute_client.servers.get, server.id, callback=_show_progress, ): self.app.stdout.write(_('Complete\n')) else: LOG.error(_('Error recreating server: %s'), server.id) self.app.stdout.write(_('Error recreating server\n')) raise SystemExit image_client = self.app.client_manager.image details = _prep_server_detail(compute_client, image_client, server, refresh=False) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(details)))

commit_message:
WIP / DNM - add functional test for software config transport glitch

In this commit we add functional testing for the glitch that occurs in a
post convergence Heat deployment, in which POLL_SERVER_HEAT breaks,
whilst POLL_TEMP_URL succeeds.

Change-Id: I90c8d651bb035fdbb0566ac81fb92cdeb186e1b6
Story: 2007528

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib import decorators from heat_tempest_plugin.common import test from heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional import functional_base test_create_template = ''' heat_template_version: queens parameters: flavor: type: string image: type: string resources: net: type: OS::Neutron::Net properties: name: nova subnet: type: OS::Neutron::Subnet properties: network: {get_resource: net} cidr: 11.11.11.0/24 server: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: {get_param: image} flavor: {get_param: flavor} networks: - subnet: {get_param: subnet} - fixed_ip: 11.11.11.11 user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG software_config_transport: POLL_TEMP_URL config: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: config: | #!/bin/bash echo 'hello' group1: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: 10 resource_def: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL group2: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: 10 resource_def: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL ''' test_update_template = ''' heat_template_version: queens resources: server: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: cirros flavor: m1.extra_tiny networks: - network: nova user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG software_config_transport: POLL_SERVER_HEAT config: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: config: | #!/bin/bash echo 'hello' group1: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: 10 resource_def: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL ''' class CreateStackTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): def get_outputs(self, stack_identifier, output_key): stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) return self._stack_output(stack, output_key) def test_create_stack_with_poll_temp_url(self): params = { 'flavor': self.conf.minimal_instance_type, 'image': self.conf.minimal_image_ref } stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template = test_create_template, stack_name = 'test_stack', parameters = params)

commit_message:
Add property "noopfirewall_or_firewall_disabled"

Added new property to "SecurityGroupAgentRpc" class,
"noopfirewall_or_firewall_disabled". If the security group API is not
enabled or the firewall configured is "NoopFirewallDriver", the property
will return "True".

Related-Bug: #1732067

Change-Id: I64db2f259462570e4c1d8df7396d188519071431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/76/752676/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-02 09:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/dib.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/selinux-permissive-a059f42bb66373a1.yaml', 'dib/ironic-python-agent-ramdisk/element-deps'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder/commit/5eebab3fc1973fdc4f2bc57ca0c7ac904bac249e', 'message': "Force SELinux to be in permissive mode

The Fedora based ramdisk is outright broken with SELinux enforcing.
TripleO actually ships its ramdisks with selinux-permissive, let's
do the same.

Change-Id: Icfec4b8109a0ddefeb0f200c3fd1f1e2de104839
"}]
commit_message:
Force SELinux to be in permissive mode

The Fedora based ramdisk is outright broken with SELinux enforcing.
TripleO actually ships its ramdisks with selinux-permissive, let's
do the same.

Change-Id: Icfec4b8109a0ddefeb0f200c3fd1f1e2de104839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder refs/changes/03/760803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove six.byte2int/int2byte

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.byte2int
- six.int2byte
- six.u
- six.b
- six.unichr
- six.get_method_self
- six.wraps

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

Change-Id: I931e717cd18b866c9577089b1237b663513c173e
Implements: blueprint six-removal
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/727777/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove six.iteritems/itervalues/iterkeys

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.iteritems
- six.itervalues
- six.iterkeys

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

Change-Id: Id55de3a105bedcf61bcfc797aabe86d6e75709c8

Remove references to Python 2.7

We don't support it anymore. This is just noise now.

Change-Id: I3640e7d8e520db69f83f95e9c7759279f7c15008
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/15/761615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Python 3.x Compatibility ------------------------ OpenStackClient strives to be Python 3.3 compatible. Common guidelines: * Convert print statements to functions: print statements should be converted to an appropriate log or other output mechanism. * Prefer to x.items() over six.iteritems(x). Running Tests ------------- Note: Oh boy, are we behind on writing tests. But they are coming! The testing system is based on a combination of tox and testr. If you just want to run the whole suite, run `tox` and all will be fine. However, if you'd like to dig in a bit more, you might want to learn some things about testr itself. A basic walkthrough for OpenStack can be found at http://wiki.openstack.org/testr

Build containers for single consumer job

consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

This review allows the operator to specify a nic to bound a VIP to.
It does so in two different ways:
1) Via a global 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic' hiera key.
For example setting 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo'
will make sure all VIPs are added to the 'lo' network interface.

2) The global setting can be overriden via a custom hiera
hash called ' force_vip_nic_overrides' so that we can
override the binding nic for specific VIPs. For example:

  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

Will make sure that the redis_vip and the ovn_dbs_vip will
be bound to the 'vip-test-nic'.

Tested with:
  tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

And correctly got all VIPs running on lo:
1: lo    inet 192.168.24.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
1: lo    inet 172.23.1.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

except for redis and ovn_dbs which are on the vip-test-nic:
5: vip-test-nic    inet 172.25.1.7/32 scope global vip-test-nic\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Note: The interface is intentionally kept in hiera as this change
will only be needed whenever BGP runs on all nodes and advertises the
VIPs across the ASN.

Change-Id: Iaa2676655d97a66237a3bd6066985f87d3565a4d

commit_message:
Allow to specify a nic for the VIPs

This review allows the operator to specify a nic to bind to a VIP to.
It does so in two different ways:
1) Via a global 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic' hiera key.
For example setting 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo'
will make sure all VIPs are added to the 'lo' network interface.

2) The global setting can be overriden via a custom hiera
hash called 'force_vip_nic_overrides' so that we can
override the binding nic for specific VIPs. For example:

  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

Will make sure that the redis_vip and the ovn_dbs_vip will
be bound to the 'vip-test-nic'.

Tested with:
  tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

And correctly got all VIPs running on lo:
1: lo    inet 192.168.24.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
1: lo    inet 172.23.1.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

except for redis and ovn_dbs which are on the vip-test-nic:
5: vip-test-nic    inet 172.25.1.7/32 scope global vip-test-nic\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Note: The interface is intentionally kept in hiera as this change
will only be needed whenever BGP runs on all nodes and advertises the
VIPs across the ASN (i.e. we do not want to make it very exposed just
yet)

Change-Id: Iaa2676655d97a66237a3bd6066985f87d3565a4d

subject: Convert software image properties to byte
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-29 01:27:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/9f128c5f7ca2729fc9c46d091802f01343515643', 'message': "Convert software image properties to byte

Convert softwareImage properties such as 'min_disk', 'min_ram' and
'size' to bytes before storing it to 'vnf_software_images' db table.
Since the size in bytes will be a large number, the type of
'min_disk' and 'min_ram' columns of 'vnf_software_images' tables has
been changed to BigInt.

Closes-Bug: #1879436
Co-Authored-By: Prashant Bhole <prash.bhole@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Convert software image properties to byte

Convert softwareImage properties such as 'min_disk', 'min_ram' and
'size' to bytes before storing it to 'vnf_software_images' db table.
Since the size in bytes will be a large number, the type of
'min_disk' and 'min_ram' columns of 'vnf_software_images' tables has
been changed to BigInt.

Closes-Bug: #1879436
Co-Authored-By: Prashant Bhole <prash.bhole@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3bf839783863f84f507d9b15c6eab6250d9f5d30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/36/731636/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "size":2000000000, // unit for 'size` is always in Bytes "minDisk":2000000000, // unit for 'minDisk' is always in Bytes "minRam":8192000000, // unit for 'minRam' is always in Bytes "size":1000000000, "minDisk":1000000000,

subject: Remove six.moves
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-12 15:17:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6adf4012769379bd04f7cce4accf9120f1cd7d98', 'message': 'Remove six.moves

Replace the following item with Python 3 style code.

- six.moves.configparser
- six.moves.StringIO
- six.moves.cStringIO
- six.moves.urllib
- six.moves.builtins
- six.moves.range
- six.moves.xmlrpc_client
- six.moves.http_client
- six.moves.http_cookies
- six.moves.queue
- six.moves.zip

Remove the following hacking rule.

[N327] Do not use xrange(). xrange() is not compatible with Python 3.
       Use range() or six.moves.range() instead.

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

Change-Id: Ib2c406327fef2fb4868d8050fc476a7d17706e23
Implements: blueprint six-removal
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove six.moves

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.moves.configparser
- six.moves.StringIO
- six.moves.cStringIO
- six.moves.urllib
- six.moves.builtins
- six.moves.range
- six.moves.xmlrpc_client
- six.moves.http_client
- six.moves.http_cookies
- six.moves.queue
- six.moves.zip
- six.moves.reload_module
- six.StringIO
- six.BytesIO

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

Change-Id: Ib2c406327fef2fb4868d8050fc476a7d17706e23
Implements: blueprint six-removal
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/727224/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - [N327] Do not use xrange(). xrange() is not compatible with Python 3. Use range() or six.moves.range() instead.

subject: Skip test_vnf_alarm_(respawn|scale) until ceilometer is restored
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-29 03:51:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/82fae642a6f3285e5278232fd9c9e77e0af3cdb8', 'message': 'Skip test_vnf_alarm_(respawn|scale) until ceilometer is restored

Unless ceilometer is present, these tests are meaningless and
vnf creation fails because alarming itself relies on it.

Change-Id: Ibed5e96067ccbba8955b565f0811a80e9f069173
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-11-08 23:58:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/5a1d08394529429cea3aea043bf0a18b9c00591b', 'message': "Skip test_vnf_alarm_(respawn|scale) until ceilometer is restored

Unless ceilometer is present, these tests are meaningless and
vnf creation fails because alarming itself relies on it. We mustn't
forget to revert this when doing Change #757537.

Change-Id: Ibed5e96067ccbba8955b565f0811a80e9f069173
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-11-09 04:36:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/e77acb2b560b2a5662fa49f77740659b7c35f9a1', 'message': "Skip test_vnf_alarm_(respawn|scale) until ceilometer is restored

Unless ceilometer is present, these tests are meaningless and
vnf creation fails because alarming itself relies on it. We mustn't
forget to revert this when doing Change #757537.

Change-Id: Ibed5e96067ccbba8955b565f0811a80e9f069173

commit_message:
Skip test_vnf_alarm_(respawn|scale) until ceilometer is restored

Unless ceilometer is present, these tests are meaningless and
vnf creation fails because alarming itself relies on it. We mustn't
forget to revert this when doing Change [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757537

Change-Id: Ibed5e96067ccbba8955b565f0811a80e9f069173

commit_message:
Pass ovs agent config to dhcp agent

Since metadata server is accessed via dhcp namespace, dhcp relies on
conf.OVS.datapath_type for [0] logic to disable checksum offloading
that is not supported with ovs-dpdk, making metadata server not available.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/stable/train/neutron/agent/linux/interface.py#L444-L446

Change-Id: I382af9d9e83b39fd9a616351e7cd5a752a603e77
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
Add properties field to port resource

The spec proposes adding a properties field to the port resource, this field
is used to store various information related with this port, including name,
link modes, etc, thus provides more intuitive information when operating ports.

Story: 2003004
Task: 28646

Change-Id: I87658274d36985f38dbadb67a849a32cd9be6548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/58/626858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Add name support to port ======================== https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003091 The spec proposes adding a name field to the port resource. Problem description =================== We have supported name field in the node and portgroup, but not port. In some cases we need to operate on the port, or update port, the name can provide better mnemonic than MAC address from the perspective of user. E.g.: #. Register a port group from available ports; #. Manually update local_link_connection of a port; #. Change the physical network of a port. It's more user friendly if user can operate on a name with *Consistent Network Device Naming* instead of MACs. The name of NICs can be collected by introspection, but this is beyond the scope of this spec. Proposed change =============== Adds a name field to db and node object, and exposes the field from API. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Adds a ``name`` column to the port table, the field is nullable, non-unique. It's not practical for getting a port by name, so no support will be added. State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- The API microversion will be bumped, the ``name`` field will be returned with supported microversion. For request modifies a port, if the ``name`` is specified and the microversion is lower than the feature implemented, 406 will be returned. The ``name`` field will be returned in following endpoints: * ``GET /v1/ports``: List ports. * ``GET /v1/ports/detail``: List ports with detailed fields. * ``GET /v1/ports/{port_id}``: Get a port with detailed fields. * ``PATCH /v1/ports/{port_id}``: Update a port. The ``name`` field can be specified when creating a port: * ``POST /v1/ports`` Client (CLI) impact ------------------- "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ None "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Add supports to display the ``name`` field on port resources. * Enhance port create command to support specifying ``name`` field. RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Ramdisk impact -------------- None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kaifeng <kaifeng.w@gmail.com> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- - Support port name in DB - Support port name in API Dependencies ============ This feature is necessary for collecting NIC names. Testing ======= Will covered by unit tests and tempest. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== Database change will be covered by db migration, the API compabitility is maintained by microversion. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Ensure admin_url specifies v1 suffix

This aligns the admin endpoint with internal and public endpoints,
and allows the swift client to properly communicate with the
the admin endpoint (LP: #1902944).

commit_message:
ovn: Do not schedule SNAT routers on computes

Currently we set enable-chassis-as-gw on compute nodes when distributed FIP
is enabled - that is not required for FIP functionality.

Change-Id: Ic880a9479fa0cdbb1d1cae3dbe9523ef2e1132ce
Closes-Bug: #1901960

commit_message:
Remove unicode quotes from tox.ini

On some locales and some versions of python these quotes might not
decode properly, causing tox to fail to run pep8 environment, so
let's change them to the usual ASCII ones.

Change-Id: Ib60844aa222c65c7862adf817c5cb73e1d1cf5f4

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I6f19f5cd5a7309fe1f36a993d00e389b844949e7
(cherry picked from commit 37b4a2d2a428394864387564afbf6b6f4330fcca)

commit_message:
Use a consolidated gate queue for integrated jobs

When gating OSA patches, they should all be gated in an integrated
queue rather than one queue per role.

Change-Id: I910075827083d2d8839ed625b1cbe5cf8a817667

commit_message:
Test compute RPC signature compatibility

This patch adds a generic test that calls each compute RPC method with
each supported RPC version and see if the call signature is valid from
the RCP server perspective.

This is created to detect errors like the one fixed in
I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236

Change-Id: I8c01b8718576f92e7c8393fd2f290c8a949f3a5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/761816/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import inspect import traceback import mock from oslo_messaging.rpc import client as rpc_client from nova.compute import manager from nova.compute import rpcapi as compute_rpcapi from nova import context from nova import objects from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures from nova.tests.functional import fixtures as func_fixtures from nova.tests.unit import cast_as_call class ComputeRpcSignatureCompatibilityTestCase(test.TestCase): # Set it True to see a detailed trace about the run of RPC method calls DEBUG = False def setUp(self): super().setUp() self.useFixture(cast_as_call.CastAsCall(self)) self.useFixture(fixtures.SpawnIsSynchronousFixture()) self.useFixture(func_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) self.hostname = 'host1' self._start_compute(host=self.hostname) def _debug(self, msg): if self.DEBUG: print(msg) def test_signature_compatibility(self): """Verify that the RCP client sends calls the RPC handler on the server side with a compatible signature. For example this test case detects if a new parameter added to an existing RPC method in a version bump but the param does not made optional on the server side. Therefore when the older RPC clients call the server without the new param the server side will fail with a TypeError due to incompatible call signature. The implementation of the test is generic to exercise all the compute RPC methods with all the supported RCP versions. The test gathers all the RCP methods from the ComputeAPI() For each RCP method and for each RPC version call the method with while the RCP version is pinned. Fake value are generated as actual parameters for the RPC call, so that the call passes the RPC client, RPC routing, RPC serialization, and the implementation of the decorators top of the RPC handler methods. Then the test asserts how the RCP method call ended: a) the call raised a specific TypeError exception right at the RPC handler method. => make test fail. This is the case we are testing for. b) the call raised an exception inside the RCP handler. This is expected due to the fake actual parameters of the call => OK c) the call returns without exception => OK d) the call raises an exception _before_ reaching the RPC handler. => Fail the test as we cannot make sure that the RPC signature is compatible. This is an error in the test itself. See the comments throughout the test implementation to get an idea how to avoid these situations. """ max_rpc = manager.ComputeManager.target.version max_rpc_major, max_rpc_minor = max_rpc.split('.') max_rpc_minor = int(max_rpc_minor) # these are not RPC methods, so we will not test them ignore_list = [ 'get_client', 'supports_numa_live_migration', 'supports_resize_with_qos_port' ] # get all the RPC client methods from the ComputeAPI class methods = inspect.getmembers( compute_rpcapi.ComputeAPI(), inspect.ismethod) methods = {method_name: method for method_name, method in methods # methods with name starting with and underscore are # assumed to be a helper and skipped. if (not method_name.startswith('_') and method_name not in ignore_list)} # for each compute RPC method for name, method in methods.items(): # for each RPC minor version in the last major version for rpc_minor in reversed(range(0, max_rpc_minor + 1)): version = max_rpc_major + '.' + str(rpc_minor) # run the RPC version while the RPC pinned to the given version self._run_rpc(method, version) # if this test step did not raised then we consider the step as # succeeded. We drop the logs to avoid causing subunit parser # errors due to logging too much at the end of the test case. self.stdlog.delete_stored_logs() def _exec_reached_rpc_handler(self, exc, handler_function_name): """Check the traceback in the exception to see if the execution is reached the RPC handler method on the server side of the RPC. """ # handle chained exceptions by concatenating the stack frames. This is # not perfect if a lot of code is executed in between the two # exceptions. But it is good enough for us for now. frames = traceback.extract_tb(exc.__traceback__) while exc.__context__ is not None: exc = exc.__context__ frames += traceback.extract_tb(exc.__traceback__) # first skip the function calls until the server side of the RPC is # reached to avoid match the client side method name. # then search forward until we find the method name of the RPC method # in the stack reached_rpc_server_side = False for frame in frames: if 'oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py' in frame.filename: reached_rpc_server_side = True continue if not reached_rpc_server_side: continue if frame.name == handler_function_name: return True return False def _generate_args(self, method): """Generate an acceptable but fake argument list for the method This is a hack. We generate fake values for each parameter by simply using the name of the parameter as the value of it too. This will pass the generic RPC serialization, but eventually it will make the handler method to fail in the compute manager. This is OK as it allow us to see the that handler method signature is compatible with the caller before the actual implementation of the handler method fails due to our fake param values. """ ctxt = context.get_admin_context() args = [] for param_name, param in inspect.signature(method).parameters.items(): # There are special cases though. We need to set some of the # param's value to our compute hostname as these params are used by # the caller to select the target compute host of the call. # Also some of the rpcapi methods do transformation on the param # before sending it so we accommodate for that too by providing a # valid type. # Passing an almost real instance object also helps to avoid # failing in the decorators of the RCP handler methods before the # actual handler is called. if param_name in ['host', 'destination']: args.append(self.hostname) elif param_name == 'instance': from nova.tests.unit import fake_instance args.append(fake_instance.fake_instance_obj( ctxt, host=self.hostname)) elif param_name == 'migration': args.append(objects.Migration( source_compute=self.hostname, dest_compute=self.hostname)) elif param_name == 'request_spec': args.append(objects.RequestSpec()) else: args.append(param_name) # we assume that the first argument of each rpc method is a context # as this context is used by the caller too we need to provide a real # context here args[0] = ctxt return args def _run_rpc(self, method, version_cap): """Run an RPC method while the RCP version is pinned.""" self.flags(compute=version_cap, group='upgrade_levels') # need to reset the cached rpc version cap to get it recalculated for # the next call compute_rpcapi.reset_globals() args = self._generate_args(method) self._call_rpc_client_method(method, args, version_cap) # We need to mock the EventReporter as it runs before the RCP handler # due to wrap_instance_event decorator and fails before we can reach # the RPC handler @mock.patch('nova.compute.utils.EventReporter', new=mock.MagicMock()) def _call_rpc_client_method(self, method, args, version_cap): try: rsp = method(*args) except Exception as e: if (isinstance(e, TypeError) and str(e).startswith(f'{method.__name__}()')): # This is a what the test wanted to detect. An incompatible # RPC handler self._debug( f'{method.__name__} in {version_cap}: ERROR ( {e} )') self.fail( f'Incompatible RPC method signature detected for ' f'{method}s method in {version_cap} version: {e}') if self._exec_reached_rpc_handler(e, method.__name__): # We reached the RPC handler and failed inside it. This is # expected due the fake parameter values. If the execution # reached the RPC handler implementation then we can be sure # that the method signature is compatible. self._debug( f'{method.__name__} in {version_cap}: ' f'OK, exception is raised from inside the RPC handler ' f'( {type(e)}: {e} )') else: # the execution did not reached the RPC handler so we don't # know if the signature is compatible or not if (isinstance(e, rpc_client.RPCVersionCapError) or 'Compute too old' in str(e) or 'Compute RPC version pin does not allow cache_images() ' 'to be called' in str(e)): # This is OK the RPC client rejected the call as the RPC # version is too old so no need for signature check. self._debug( f'{method.__name__} in {version_cap}: ' f'OK, RCP client rejected the call as the version is ' f'too old ( {e} )') else: # If we are here then an exception is raised before the # the RPC handler is reached. This is an error in the # test. Probably a decorator injected some code before # the RPC handler that fails due to the fake call # parameters. This test case needs to be adapted to avoid # this situation self._debug( f'{method.__name__} in {version_cap}: TESTING ERROR: ' f'the RPC call failed before the RPC handler method ' f'so the test cannot prove that the signature is ' f'compatible ( {type(e)}: {e} )') raise else: # Our RPC call run without any exception so the signature must # be compatible. self._debug( f'{method.__name__} in {version_cap}: ' f'OK, RPC handler run without exception: {rsp}')

commit_message:
Add server migration list CLI

Add ``openstack server migration list`` to fetch server migrations.

Part of blueprint add-user-id-field-to-the-migrations-table

Change-Id: I15b4a5aca8d0dee59dd293e7b1c7272cdfbeea20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/04/675304/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random self.migrations = mock.Mock() self.migrations.resource_class = fakes.FakeResource(None, {}) class FakeServerMigration(object): """Fake one or more server migrations.""" @staticmethod def create_one_server_migration(attrs=None, methods=None): """Create a fake server migration. :param Dictionary attrs: A dictionary with all attributes :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods :return: A FakeResource object, with id, type, and so on """ attrs = attrs or {} methods = methods or {} # Set default attributes. migration_info = { "dest_host": "10.0.2.15", "status": "migrating", "type": "migration", "updated_at": "2017-01-31T08:03:25.000000", "created_at": "2017-01-31T08:03:21.000000", "dest_compute": "compute-" + uuid.uuid4().hex, "id": random.randint(1, 999), "source_node": "node-" + uuid.uuid4().hex, "instance_uuid": uuid.uuid4().hex, "dest_node": "node-" + uuid.uuid4().hex, "source_compute": "compute-" + uuid.uuid4().hex, "uuid": uuid.uuid4().hex, "old_instance_type_id": uuid.uuid4().hex, "new_instance_type_id": uuid.uuid4().hex, "project_id": uuid.uuid4().hex, "user_id": uuid.uuid4().hex } # Overwrite default attributes. migration_info.update(attrs) migration = fakes.FakeResource(info=copy.deepcopy(migration_info), methods=methods, loaded=True) return migration @staticmethod def create_server_migrations(attrs=None, methods=None, count=2): """Create multiple fake server migrations. :param Dictionary attrs: A dictionary with all attributes :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods :param int count: The number of server migrations to fake :return: A list of FakeResource objects faking the server migrations """ migrations = [] for i in range(0, count): migrations.append( FakeServerMigration.create_one_server_migration( attrs, methods)) return migrations @staticmethod def get_server_migrations(migrations=None, count=2): """Get an iterable MagicMock object with a list of faked migrations. If server migrations list is provided, then initialize the Mock object with the list. Otherwise create one. :param List migrations: A list of FakeResource objects faking server migrations :param int count: The number of server migrations to fake :return: An iterable Mock object with side_effect set to a list of faked server migrations """ if migrations is None: migrations = FakeServerMigration.create_server_migrations(count) return mock.Mock(side_effect=migrations)

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I6ed8fe0cc60cd2775a8ae60ed22a4824f4bc7aad
(cherry picked from commit f78ed44e5e7a39f343cb2abf6d05074d08fd78e9)

commit_message:
Switch tripleo jobs to content provider

Content provider job builds and shares the artifacts among
consumer jobs. This removes dependency on docker.io pulls.

subject: Add a new type HostDomain.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-03 15:26:38.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_types.py', 'oslo_config/types.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-HostDomain-implement-rfc1033-c985a3054f824e9d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/1fcb3e8acd3c229c74c87d80fd183cfc2432bace', 'message': 'Add a new type HostDomain.

HostDomain is like HostAddress with the support of
_ character - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscore
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

FQDN is a domain name that specifies its exact
location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS).

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore with the `HostDomain`.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a0670207f96a987996d329e5efa9a5eb2ce000c
Closes-Bug: #1892044
(cherry picked from commit 6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75)
(cherry picked from commit f37bcc779347c9e0d1e37258a6d072b718edf7f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new type HostDomain.

HostDomain is like HostAddress with the support of
_ character - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscore
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

FQDN is a domain name that specifies its exact
location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS).

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore with the `HostDomain`.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a0670207f96a987996d329e5efa9a5eb2ce000c
Closes-Bug: #1892044
(cherry picked from commit 6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75)
(cherry picked from commit f37bcc779347c9e0d1e37258a6d072b718edf7f7)

commit_message:
Do not symlink ceph libraries for distro path

ceph_client role checks length of the `openstack_service_venv_bin` variable
to determine if libraries symlinking into venv should occur. So for
distro path this should be empty string as no symlinking should be done.

Change-Id: I775d882382b06110358879034f735a8c6e73ec93
(cherry picked from commit 3876d573648b21adee9d49ce2bc27b84846ea47d)

commit_message:
Create module for overcloud image build

In order to be able to drop the DIB default requirement on
tripleoclient, we can use an ansible playbook to pull in the
dependencies prior to executing the build process via an ansible module.

Change-Id: Ib74a60189baf530f91da36c30019733d2cd480ee

commit_message:
Use ansible for image build

By switching to an ansible playbook and module to do the image building
process (not containers), we can drop the tripleoclient dependnecies
that are pulled in for image building.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759953/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760208/
Change-Id: Ia537d26bf50f3d6e04d795541285af74a96d878e

Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

commit_message:
Fix: nrpe queue check should check for freshness

Make the rabbitmq queue check also check if its input data file was
recently updated. This input data is created via cronjob; if that gets
stuck we might not actually be getting meaningful data.

The charm supports configuring the check interval via a full cron time
specification, so technically one could have that updated only once a
year even if this doesn't make much sense in a monitoring scenario.

Also fix a buglet in the nrpe update hook function: only deploy a
queue check if the cron job hasn't been deconfigured by setting it to
the empty string

Change-Id: I60141397f39e3b1b0274230db8d984934c98a08d
Closes-Bug: #1898523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server refs/changes/55/757955/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from itertools import chain, dropwhileimport osimport time CRON_FILE = "/etc/cron.d/rabbitmq-stats"def get_cron_fields(cronspec): """Return leftmost non-starred cron entry fields""" parts = cronspec.split() # How many fields from the end of the spec are non-*? nonstar = list(reversed( list(dropwhile(lambda a: a == '*', reversed(parts))))) return nonstar def get_star_interv(part): """Cron slice: return x for the */x case, or None""" out = None # Couldn't find a starred value if part.startswith('*/'): out = int(part[2:]) # Illegal, let exception bubble up if out == 0: # x/0 -> return None for full interval return return out def max_cron_minutes_interval(cronspec): """Determine upper boundary for cronjob interval Given a cron time specification return - None if the interval is >24h - an upper boundary in minutes for the cron job interval """ fields = get_cron_fields(cronspec) fields_num = len(fields) if fields_num > 2: # we're looking at mins, hours only return if not fields: # no fields --> all are starred, interval 1min return 1 star_interv = get_star_interv( fields[-1]) # rightmost field is either min or hour if star_interv is None: # Invalid/unfound value -> use maximums if fields_num == 2: star_interv = 24 # hours else: star_interv = 60 # minutes max_minutes = (60 ** (fields_num - 1)) * star_interv return max_minutes def age_minutes(time_secs): return (time.time() - time_secs) / 60 def check_stats_file_freshness(stats_file): with open(CRON_FILE) as cronjob: specparts = cronjob.read().split('root') if len(specparts) != 2: return ("CRIT", "Expected 'root' in {}".format(cronfile)) max_interval = max_cron_minutes_interval(specparts[0]) if max_interval is None: # Longer then 24h: don't check freshness return ("OK", "") file_mod_age = age_minutes(os.path.getmtime(stats_file)) if file_mod_age > (max_interval + 5): # +5min grace period for the job return ( "CRIT", "Rabbit stats file not updated for {} minutes".format( max_interval + 5) ) return ("OK", "") freshness_results = [check_stats_file_freshness(f) for f in args.c] criticals.append( msg for status, msg in freshness_results if status == "CRIT" )

commit_message:
zuul: Reintroduce nova-dsvm-multinode-base

This was incorrectly removed by
Ib342e2d3c395830b4667a60de7e492d3b9de2f0a while still being used by the
nova-grenade-multinode job. This was missed as the check queue appears
to default to silently skipping jobs where it can't find the parent
instead of failing.

Change-Id: I3ece71ab75a28a0ba662c56fb140525e8ce4aa6c

commit_message:
Use more generic TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated[1], we should start using the
new better shiny TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead.
Also this should fix broken tinyipa jobs after this[2] change merged.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/760703

Change-Id: I99762e25133967c31679d2962607b2bf30459af5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder refs/changes/34/761334/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pre-formatted strings for logging#!/bin/bash -eutox_constraints_is_not_null() { test "${TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" != "" copy "${TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" "${DESTINATION}" download "${TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" "${DESTINATION}" # TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE in tox.ini. This is used by image url=$(sed -n 's/^.*{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE\:\([^}]*\)}.*$/\1/p' $TOX_INI | head -n1)if tox_constraints_is_not_null; then log "TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is defined as '${TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}'" copy_uc || download_uc || fail "Failed to copy or download file indicated in TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE." log "TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is not defined. Using fallback strategies."
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash -euupper_constraints_is_not_null() { test "${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" != "" copy "${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" "${DESTINATION}" download "${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}" "${DESTINATION}" # UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE in tox.ini. This is used by image url=$(sed -n 's/^.*{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE\:\([^}]*\)}.*$/\1/p' $TOX_INI | head -n1)if upper_constraints_is_not_null; then log "UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is defined as '${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:-""}'" copy_uc || download_uc || fail "Failed to copy or download file indicated in UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE." log "UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is not defined. Using fallback strategies."

commit_message:
NRPE: Don't report paused hacluster nodes as CRITICAL error

Previously, paused hacluster units showed up CRITICAL error
in nagios even though they were only in the 'standby' mode
in corosync.
The hacluster charm now uses the '-s' option of the check_crm
nrpe script to ignore alerts of the standby units.

Change-Id: I976d5ff01d0156fbaa91f9028ac81b44c96881af
Closes-Bug: #1880576
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster refs/changes/16/758416/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elsif ( $line =~ m/\s*stopped\:\s*\[\s(.*)\s\]/i ) { my @stopped_nodes = split ' ', $1; my $report_nodes = ""; for my $node (@stopped_nodes) { # Don't report standby nodes if 'standbyignore' is specified if ( $np->opts->standbyignore && grep { $node eq $_ } @standby ) { next } $report_nodes .= "${node} " } if ( $report_nodes ne "") { $np->add_message( $warn_or_crit, ": $report_nodes Stopped" ); }

commit_message:
Fix deploying using heat-container-agent:victoria-dev

It seems that latest heat-container-agent:victoria-dev doesn't use the exported variable from /etc/bashrc
It's due to scripts not using /bin/bash shebang

Starting the heat-container-agent with the appropriate env fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ib359297f9c21ab96c5e1e925b14e6644fdbfd9be
Story: 2007591

commit_message:
Cleanup old workaround for ipv6 VIPs

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1445628 has been fixed
in RHEL 7.3. There is no need to carry around this workaround any
longer.

We can entirely remove the nic parameter since it is set to '' by
default anyway in puppet-pacemaker.

Change-Id: Ia41046f148e0593ea773e8409494ce5dcca4b7a2
(cherry picked from commit 2b44f5c31916f3d549a560b03c7ba7caf94c2189)

commit_message:
Stop aborting the process on periodic task failures

It's nice to know when a periodic task fails, but aborting the whole
process makes it fragile in the events of e.g. problems with accessing
ironic, even if transient.

Simplify the overly complex unit tests and split the dual-purpose task.

Story: #2007622
Task: #39653
Change-Id: I64f5ca6e377a4cdfa08319ef9973b591cc552121

commit_message:
Skip WritableMtuTest for OVN

The test requires east/west fragmentation which
is currently not supported in core OVN.

Co-Authored-By: Yatin Karel <ykarel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e6e0585fdcc984437a7913e80170889c797563c
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixing test_ipblock_network_policy_sg_rules

The test was unstable, because it was only waiting for the SG to get
created assuming rules are created in the same moment. It's not true,
rules will follow and we need to account for that.

Commit fixes that by making sure we're waiting until all the rules are
in the status of KuryrNetworkPolicy.

Closes-Bug: 1860554
Depends-On: I3bbac8e90553be9424fa0ecdb4c05e096da8f2d7
Change-Id: I7fb66c86982b4b7d3e3296cbecda0fd6839b1177

commit_message:
Increase timeout to read pod commands results

exec_command_in_pod was hanging from time to time and we've set a 10
seconds timeout waiting for a response from it. This might be too little
as we very often see empty responses being returned. This commit
attempts to solve the issue by setting default timeout to 60 seconds.
Also the method used is changed from connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec to
connect_post_namespaced_pod_exec. This is what `kubectl` uses to
perform `exec`, so hopefully it'll be more reliable.

Depends-On: I3bbac8e90553be9424fa0ecdb4c05e096da8f2d7
Change-Id: I49ac4d066a0bd0da3833dcbf41655f7c9e374fd9

commit_message:
[Validator Run] Ensure the plan really exists

This patch will now fetch all the existing plans and will ensure the
plan given by the command line is part of it. If not, a exception will
be raised to inform the user.

Change-Id: If45db93e4e958fe0ae65bd2cd96d3594b97a4320
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit da8a3e59645b2b17a1b05dc1853d1d9fd7e7c424)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/16/760516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tripleoclient.workflows import plan_management clients = self.app.client_manager plans = plan_management.list_deployment_plans(clients) if parsed_args.plan and parsed_args.plan not in plans: raise exceptions.CommandError( _("The plan '{}' doesn't exist. " "Please use one of those {}".format(parsed_args, plans)))

jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

commit_message:
[Docs] Add info about how multicast is treated by fw drivers

This patch adds info about how multicast traffic is treated by
openvswitch and iptables based firewall drivers.
Patch [1] was trying to fix behaviour of OVS based driver to make
it similar to how iptables drivers works but it introduced bug [2]
which we wasn't able to fix without basically disabling what [1] did
for some ports on the compute nodes.
So based on that we decided to revert [1] - it is done in [3] and to
document different behaviour between those 2 firewall drivers which is
done by this patch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748719/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1899967
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759555/

Change-Id: If8a56579c62f58befdc57f5916a5763e9fb99531
Related-Bug: #1899967
Related-Bug: #1889631

Fix Cinder CSI

A regression issue introduced by [1], which is causing Cinder CSI pods
failed to start. This patch will fixed it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749101/

Task: 41097
Story: 2008250

commit_message:
Install lbaas agent pkg only when needed

The lbaas recipe is meant to be run on a controller node, while the
lbaas_agent recipe is for a network node. Installing the lbaas agent
package on a controller leads to a failing service being started.
In order to avoid that, we need to split up the package lists and
install the agent only when it is needed.
Installing the lbaas agent on a controller node instead of a network

Change-Id: I8742e59bf5a07f1e26461e29f3cb2a1267b20925

commit_message:
zuul: Replace nova-live-migration with zuulv3 jobs

This change removes the original nova-live-migration job and replaces it
directly with the new Focal based zuulv3 native job.

The nova-dsvm-multinode-base base job is no longer used and so also
removed as part of this change.

Note that this new nova-live-migration job does not yet contain any
ceph coverage like the original, this is still pending and will be
completed early in the W cycle.

This change is being merged ahead of this to resolve bug #1901739, a
known QEMU -drive issue caused by the previous jobs use of libvirt 5.4.0
as provided by Ubuntu Bionic. The fix here being the migration to Ubuntu
Focal based jobs and libvirt 6.0.0 that now defaults to using QEMU
-blockdev.

Closes-Bug: #1901739
Change-Id: Ib342e2d3c395830b4667a60de7e492d3b9de2f0a

commit_message:
Run publish-openstack-artifacts on ubuntu-focal

The publish-openstack-artifacts job is a parent to a number of
release jobs, including release-openstack-python. In order to build
wheels with new enough metadata to support alternative long
description content types, run these jobs on the ubuntu-focal
nodeset rather than the OpenDev's current default of ubuntu-bionic.

Change-Id: I3399422251d25680688f4982e9a731b9d6485894

commit_message:
Load projects without restrictions in policy_check

The policy_check needs to load projects without project safe restriction
because it is possible for users to attach policies belonging to other
projects.

Change-Id: I019e7765bdce3f3338167ce11660f4eae70639fc
Closes-Bug: #1896099

commit_message:
Fix out of range value in vnf_software_images

This update is to fix a DataError in `vnf_software_images` table because
of out of range value for column 'min_ram' as bellow. It's defined as
Integer type, but not enough for the data. So, change to BigInteger.

```
tacker-conductor[104762]: [SQL: INSERT INTO vnf_software_images (created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, deleted, id, software_image_id, flavour_uuid, name, provider, version, algorithm, hash,>
...
tacker-conductor[104762]: 2020-11-07 04:43:31.679 104762 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server pymysql.err.DataError: (1264, "Out of range value for column 'min_ram' at row 1")
```

Closes-Bug: #1903479
Change-Id: Id08239fb35b6c0d0399c44b84d5d20d3f4924d9b
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix o-hm0 port creation from action

Defer hm port setup to main charm code instead of
doing it as part of action. This means we get to
avoid the error prone action method of creating
the port.

Closes-Bug: #1902765

Change-Id: Ieab07308103c791f899ec9cb8066283540f9d96e

commit_message:
Remove c7 containers multinode job

This job was kept initially to maintain coverage on c7, since
there is no user of CentOS-7 train, so we are removing this
job.

A periodic version of the job will be still running in the
upstream infra, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752029/

Removal of this job is planned as a part of moving to
centos-8 based content provider jobs.

Change-Id: I520be957f2b260543e28f31ef6db11b211434a77
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Remove c7 containers multinode job

This job was kept initially to maintain coverage on c7, since
there is no user of CentOS-7 train, so we are removing this
job.

A periodic version of the job will be still running in the
upstream infra, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752029/

Removal of this job is planned as a part of moving to
centos-8 based content provider jobs.

Change-Id: Id61ac600c17a63e3e10293e354930e0cbc446f38
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/16/752216/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-29 07:50:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ba183a02bf0dc39e9806517b90d0a8eff55635b6', 'message': "Ensure openvswitch is started for non layered ovs upgrade

With victoria release for openvswitch RDO switched

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch is started for non layered ovs upgrade

Module 'tripleo_ovs_upgrade' handles upgrade for layered
ovs i.e rhosp-openvswitch, in RDO there is similar
package which is named rdo-openvswitch which is not handled,
We need to ensure that openvswitch is in started state
when non layered ovs is detected by 'tripleo_ovs_upgrade'.

With victoria release for openvswitch RDO switched
to NFV SIG builds which are rebuilds from Fast DataPath
builds[1], with this when there is an upgrade to victoria
old openvswitch get's removed during upgrade and thus
openvswitch service is stopped so for this case we need
to ensure openvswitch is in started state.

As part of "Update all packages" task non layered openvswitch
can get upgraded so add an additional task which get's triggered if
openvswitch is upgraded.

[1] http://ftp.redhat.com/pub/redhat/linux/enterprise/8Base/en/Fast-Datapath/

Related-Bug: #1897863
Change-Id: I53de06a6d7c4b26bf7813f375e2e9ac4cb034ad9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/760294/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch to unittest mock

Python3 have a standard library for mock in the unittest module,
let's drop the mock requirement and switch tests to unittest mock.

Change-Id: If4782eacf5704ac5728ee5ec2a921dbbf5cc062c

subject: sharding: Change default cleave_batch_size to 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-07-14 17:52:24.000000000', 'files': ['etc/container-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/218462fd8a277cea9739e20354cc1eea6dbc4a86', 'message': "sharding: Change default cleave_batch_size to 3

When sharding, we use the shard_container_threshold size to determine
both when to shard and how many rows to put in each shard (calculated
as shard_container_threshold // 2). As a result, a sharding container
in a healthy cluster typically splits into three shards.

With the previous default batch size, this would mean that sharding
would almost always require two sharder cycles to complete. This can
make for long delays in objects appearing in listings, particularly if
you're intentionally lengthening sharder and replication cycles in an
effort to reduce container-layer contention.

Change-Id: I341f5f5d2f480310c83e35a8f3c6c2e0d56dab2e
"}]
commit_message:
sharding: Change default cleave_batch_size to 3

When sharding, we use the shard_container_threshold size to determine
both when to shard and how many rows to put in each shard (calculated
as shard_container_threshold // 2). As a result, a sharding container
in a healthy cluster typically splits into three shards.

With the previous default batch size, this would mean that sharding
would almost always require two sharder cycles to complete. This can
make for long delays in objects appearing in listings, particularly if
you're intentionally lengthening sharder and replication cycles in an
effort to reduce container-layer contention.

Change-Id: I341f5f5d2f480310c83e35a8f3c6c2e0d56dab2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/16/741016/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: from trove.instance import models as ins_modelsfrom trove.instance import service_status as srvstatus @mock.patch.object(clients, 'create_nova_client', return_value=mock.MagicMock()) @mock.patch('trove.rpc.get_client') def test_update_datastore_version(self, mock_get_rpc_client, mock_create_nova_client): # Create an instance in db. instance = ins_models.DBInstance.create( name=self.random_name('instance'), flavor_id=self.random_uuid(), tenant_id=self.random_uuid(), volume_size=1, datastore_version_id=self.ds_version_imageid.id, task_status=ins_models.InstanceTasks.BUILDING, compute_instance_id=self.random_uuid() ) ins_models.InstanceServiceStatus.create( instance_id=instance.id, status=srvstatus.ServiceStatuses.NEW ) # Create a new datastore version in db. new_version_name = self.random_name('version') ds_models.update_datastore_version( self.ds_name, new_version_name, 'mysql', self.random_uuid(), [], '', 1 ) new_ds_version = ds_models.DatastoreVersion.load( self.ds, new_version_name) body = { 'instance': { 'datastore_version': new_ds_version.id } } self.controller.update(mock.MagicMock(), instance.id, body, mock.ANY) rpc_ctx = mock_get_rpc_client.return_value.prepare.return_value rpc_ctx.cast.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY, "upgrade", instance_id=instance.id, datastore_version_id=new_ds_version.id)

commit_message:
Add support to expose oem_vendors from resource links

Some BMC implementations (such as Dell G13 iDrac) report the OEM
moniker in the Links attribute and do not expose OEM info at the
resource's root level.

Change-Id: If03458858ddffeb1d3ef76621e096782e0d4d318
Signed-off-by: Manuel Schnlaub <manuel.schoenlaub@gmail.com>
Story: 2008210
Task: 40995

commit_message:
Make minion jobs use the content provider in pipeline

The -pipeline templates should have all relevant master
jobs using the content-provifer pattern.
This review adds the minion job settings to ensure it uses
content-provider

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761137/
Change-Id: I258c354d83aedb76e12fda487f5a73d69c35cb7e

commit_message:
the tag for building rpms should be build

using just the build tag allows build-test-packages
to be skipped appropriately in child jobs.

using both tags: undercloud-upgrade, build
allows build-test-packages to run w/o the build
tag.  This is not the behavior we're expecting.

Change-Id: Ia693ad7f93749d320264f72ffd18e13196c499ac
